author: @siliconcanals
title: UK-based voice AI startup Neuphonic secures €3.5M to build world’s fastest text-to-speech tech
text:
London-based Neuphonic , a startup focused on redefining human-AI communication with fast text-to-speech technology, has raised £3M (approximately €3.58M) in its pre-seed round of funding.
The investment was led by Moonfire VC , with participation from Tiny VC , Salica Oryx Fund , and Cur8 Capital .
Akshat Goenka, Partner at Moonfire, says, “Voice AI has been a sleeping giant, held back by technical limitations that Neuphonic is now solving. Their technology has the potential to unlock significant value across multiple industries.”
“In customer service, it could enable more natural, efficient interactions. For content creators, it opens up new possibilities in localisation and accessibility. In emerging fields like digital avatars and AI gaming, it could be the key to creating truly immersive experiences.”
“We see Neuphonic’s solution as a catalyst for innovation in these sectors and beyond, potentially unlocking billions in economic value. They could ultimately enable entirely new business models and user experiences that weren’t possible before.”
Enabling real-time conversational AI with TTS latency under 25ms Neuphonic is addressing the limitations of traditional Conversational AI by offering a text-to-speech algorithm (patent-pending) that enables real-time speech generation with ultra-low latency of 25 milliseconds, making it the fastest in the world.
The technology allows for more natural, human-like communication and is compatible with any Large Language Model, regardless of language. Neuphonic’s API is currently available through an exclusive closed beta programme for businesses looking to integrate human-like speech into their products.
Sohaib Ahmad, co-founder and CEO of Neuphonic, says, “High latency in Voice AI prevents natural interaction and slows growth in key fields like gaming, conversational AI, digital avatars, and real-time translation. People are struggling to really interact with Voice AI as a result.”
“We want to reach a point where AI feels like a natural extension of ourselves – intuitive and effortless. Ideally, people then spend less time staring at screens and more time actually communicating.”
Founded by Jiameng Gao and Sohaib Ahmad, Neuphonic emerged from the duo’s shared experience studying machine learning at Cambridge University.
With multilingual backgrounds and roots in China, Ireland, and Pakistan, Gao and Ahmad were inspired by their insights into language barriers and cultural nuances to develop Neuphonic.
They aim to tackle the limitations of current text-to-speech solutions, driven by a passion for voice technology.
Co-founder and CTO Gao, says, “By generating speech word-by-word as text arrives, we unlock a wide range of use cases for Text-To-Speech that wasn’t possible before – we’re in talks with businesses in customer service, digital reception, humanoid robotics, ed-tech, storytelling, and content creation.”
“This goes beyond speed improvements and allows us to create AI interactions that feel as natural and responsive as human conversation. Just as how people speak immediately, our models bypass the need for full sentences and in doing so significantly cut down latency.”
Capital utilisation Neuphonic plans to use the funds to expand its language capabilities and voice offerings, improve model performance through research, and develop on-device solutions.
Professor Steve Young CBE, Emeritus Professor of Information Engineering and former Senior Pro-Vice Chancellor of Cambridge University, says, “Neuphonic’s breakthrough in real-time speech synthesis will create a paradigm shift in human-machine interaction.”
“By reducing latency to near-human levels, they are paving the way for seamless voice interaction that could replace screens in many aspects of our daily lives.”
With a growing team and a waiting list of hundreds of potential users and businesses, Neuphonic aims for rapid growth in the voice AI market, which is projected to reach $41.39B by 2030 .

author: Staff Writer
title: Makeen and Rolls-Royce Power Systems forge partnership to manufacture mtu engines in Saudi Arabia
text:
Riyadh: Saudi Engines Manufacturing Company (Makeen), a joint venture between Aramco, HD Hyundai Heavy Industries and Dussur, signed a Framework License Agreement with Rolls-Royce’s Power Systems business unit to manufacture, test, sell and service mtu engines and gensets in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, according to a press release from Aramco.
The deal marks a milestone for the industrial development of the Kingdom’s rapidly growing marine and off-grid power generation sectors, according to the release.
Makeen’s Chairman Mohammad Al-Shammary said: “This partnership aims to have a ripple effect on the local economy, creating employment opportunities, building technological know-how, substituting heavy reliance on imports, promoting sustainable practices, and creating new opportunities for local supply chain development. This strategic collaboration further supports our contribution toward the goals of Saudi Vision 2030.”
President of Mobile and Sustainable Power Solutions at Rolls Royce Power Systems Andreas Goertz stated: “With the investment commitments of our new partner Makeen in localization, both for engine and genset production and service, we see a great opportunity to grow our business in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. It is of utmost importance for us to have a partner in Saudi Arabia that could help the supply of our mtu products to the local marine market while maintaining our high-quality standards and providing first-class service to our customers.”
According to Makeen CEO Abdullah Al-Ghamdi, the partnership with Rolls-Royce’s "aims to deliver state-of-the-art solutions to meet the evolving demands of our valued customers in oil and gas, marine, and other applications, while promoting new technologies. We are building our facilities and training our personnel to meet the high standards of quality expected from Makeen".

author: Emelina Zuzeth Gonzalez Lopez
title: Wendy Guevara habla de Salud Mental y amistad con Nicola Porcella: “Lo defendería con garras y dientes” | Noticias de México | El Imparcial
text: Wendy Guevara habla de Salud Mental y amistad con Nicola Porcella: “Lo defendería con garras y dientes” La influencer habló sobre su enfoque hacia la terapia, la amistad y su lealtad inquebrantable hacia aquellos que ama CIUDAD DE MÉXICO.- En un encuentro con los medios, Wendy Guevara compartió detalles sobre su enfoque hacia la salud mental y su inquebrantable apoyo a sus seres queridos. “Soy consciente de que no soy perfecta, pero intento ser amorosa y brindar apoyo a quienes me rodean,” afirmó la influencer. También enfatizó la importancia de recibir terapia regularmente, ya sea a través de Zoom o en persona cuando tiene la oportunidad de visitar León. A veces voy a terapia por Zoom y cuando puedo ir a León, tengo terapia presencial”, reveló Guevara, subrayando la importancia de la autoayuda en su rutina. La actriz abordó el tema de la amistad, manifestando su incomodidad con las preguntas sobre cómo es como amiga, sugiriendo que tales cuestiones deberían ser dirigidas a su círculo social cercano. “Yo creo que eso se lo tiene que preguntar a las personas de mi círculo social de amistades, porque cualquiera puede echarse flores solo o sola, pero no está bien”, afirmó. A pesar de ello, enfatizó su compromiso inquebrantable de brindar apoyo, incluso si no siempre es correspondido. Lo que siempre he tenido muy presente es que sé dar apoyo y me encanta hacerlo. Aunque a veces otras personas no lo devuelvan, no pasa nada.” Cuando se le preguntó si ella defendería a Nicola en caso de que él fuera atacado de la misma manera en que Gala Montes fue agredida en la Casa de los Famosos México por parte del influencer Adrián Marcelo, Guevara afirmó que sí lo haría. Cabe señalar que tanto Nicola Porcella como Gala Montes son actores que han hablado abiertamente sobre sus problemas mentales y la manera en la que se atienden respecto a ellos. El hecho de que Marcelo atacara a la actriz por su condición mental ha sido ampliamente criticado en redes sociales. “La depresión es un tema que se toca con pincita siempre lo he dicho es bien difícil de de tocar este tema es un debate que se hace puedes durar días debatiéndose”, aclaró Wendy. “Como amigo, yo creo que tienes que dar apoyo y abrazar cuando se necesita un abrazo, enojarte y atacar cuando se necesita atacar. Y yo a él lo hubiera defendido con garras y dientes porque lo amo”, finalizó la influencer. Tal vez te interese: [“La experiencia del embarazo está muy romantizada, se sufre mucho”, Paul Stanley comparte como fue el proceso junto a su esposa Joely Bernat]() Te recomendamos [Wendy Guevara y Nicola Porcella revelan que ya no quieren vivir con Agustín Fernández](/espectaculos/2024/08/15/wendy-guevara-y-nicola-porcella-revelan-que-ya-no-quieren-vivir-con-agustin-fernandez/) [Nicola Porcella comenta sobre el veto de Agustín Fernández en el programa “Hoy”](/espectaculos/2024/08/22/nicola-porcella-comenta-sobre-el-veto-de-agustin-fernandez-en-el-programa-hoy/) [“Que grosero”: Gomita y Nicola Porcella protagonizan acalorada pelea en vivo](/espectaculos/2024/09/03/que-grosero-gomita-y-nicola-porcella-protagonizan-acalorada-pelea-en-vivo/) [Niurka arremete contra Adrián Marcelo por burlas hacia su hijo Emilio Osorio](/espectaculos/2024/08/23/niurka-arremete-contra-adrian-marcelo-por-burlas-hacia-su-hijo-emilio-osorio/)

author: JACKSON WALKER | The National Desk
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Former ESPN anchor Sage Steele claims she was asked by the network to refrain from commenting on controversial transgender swimmer Lia Thomas.{br}{/p}{p}Lia Thomas, a transgender female, {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\"}joined {/a}the University of Pennsylvania's women’s swimming team in 2021 after originally being on the men's team. She went on to become an NCAA champion.{/p}{p}Thomas's participation in women's events was followed by the creation of “Fairness in Women’s Sports Acts,” legislation that aims to require athletes to compete based on biological sex.{/p}{p}While anchoring \"SportsCenter\" for ESPN, Steele frequently expressed opposition to Thomas and other transgender females competing in women's sports on social media. In an {a href=\"https://twitter.com/Outkick/status/1739993995311272221\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://twitter.com/Outkick/status/1739993995311272221\"}interview {/a}with women's sports activist Riley Gaines this week, she claimed her comments led to internal backlash at work.{/p}{p}“I was asked to stop tweeting about it,” Steele said. “I was asked to stop doing anything, saying anything about it on social media because I was offending others at the company. I made sure I sent up another tweet that night after I received that email because like, no.”{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/no-one-protected-us-riley-gaines-slams-transgender-participation-in-womens-sports-during-house-hearing#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/no-one-protected-us-riley-gaines-slams-transgender-participation-in-womens-sports-during-house-hearing#\"} 'No one protected us': Riley Gaines slams trans females competing in women's sports during House hearing{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1740108515254153223\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Steele and ESPN parted ways in 2023 after she launched a lawsuit claiming the company infringed her free speech rights, {a href=\"https://nypost.com/2023/12/27/sports/sage-steele-espn-said-stop-tweeting-about-trans-swimmer-lia-thomas/\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://nypost.com/2023/12/27/sports/sage-steele-espn-said-stop-tweeting-about-trans-swimmer-lia-thomas/\"}according{/a} to The New York Post. Speaking to Gaines, Steele explained the messages were part of the reason why she felt so strongly about the suit.{br}{/p}{p}“I already had the lawsuit going. I didn’t know what how it was going to end. But I literally said, this is the hill I will die on 100% because it’s facts,” she said. “This is not even my opinion about a vaccine mandate or whatever, these are facts. This is science, this is biology.\"{/p}{blockquote}\"Tell me to stop supporting women,\" Steele continued. \"Go ahead, tell me.”{/blockquote}{p}Gaines, who competed against Thomas in 2022, applauded Steele, saying she \"could not imagine being a woman working there, being asked to report on this issue with a smile on my face.\"{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/republican-governors-demand-ncaa-rewrite-transgender-student-athlete-policy-gop-kristi-noem-greg-abbott-riley-gaines-fairness-womens-sports-trans-rules-lia-thomas#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/republican-governors-demand-ncaa-rewrite-transgender-student-athlete-policy-gop-kristi-noem-greg-abbott-riley-gaines-fairness-womens-sports-trans-rules-lia-thomas#\"}Republican governors demand NCAA rewrite transgender student athlete policy{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Former University of Pennsylvania swimmer Paula Scanlan {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\"}said {/a}during a House hearing earlier this year her university forced biologically female athletes to fear for their safety by allowing Thomas into women’s locker rooms.{/p}{p}“The university was gaslighting and fearmongering women to validate the feelings and identity of a male,” Scanlan said. She claimed the University of Pennsylvania urged her to seek counseling after she presented them with concerns over sharing a locker room with Thomas.{/p}{p}ESPN declined to comment on Steele's allegations Thursday.
